phrases: Kichijouji, huh?
Hachiouji, where Azuki is living, is still another thirty minutes away by train.
It really is far.
No, he is in his first year of high school and it is summer vacation...
Even Shuujin needs a change of pace.
But is he really doing the name?
Niizuma Eiji...
There must be something I can gain from being here.
Mashiro-kun?
Ah Yes.
AhYes.
I am Nakai, nice to meet you.
Very nice to meet you.
It is kind of noisy, but come on in.
Okay.
Danger!
Danger, watch out!
Niizuma-sensei, Mashiro-kun is here.
Maybe you should give him a quick greeting.
Ah, okay.
My name's Mashiro.
I will be helping out starting today.
I am happy to be working with you.
Ah, what is up Mechadoc?
Too old?
Mechadocrow.
Mechacrow!
What is up Mechadoc?
TL Note: This is a reference to an 80's anime/manga, Yoroshiku Mechadoc.
Sensei is always like that, except when he is eating or sleeping.
And once he goes to sleep, he does not wake up for twenty hours.
Okay...
Nakai-san, please quit calling Niizuma-kun sensei.
You are seventeen years older than him, for God's sake.
This is Fukuda-kun, he started yesterday.
He placed twice for Tezuka, winning prizes both times
Fukuda...
He is really skilled.
Niizuma-sensei's editor is hoping to serialize him next.
That is him?
I am sure he ran in NEXT!
alongside me.
Very nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you too.
He is writing a name.
We have got a fair amount of extra time here,
so Fukuda-kun is using it to write a name aimed for serialization.
He sure is good.
The kid does not need three assistants.
Niizuma-kun even draws the backgrounds himself.
We basically just do fill-in inking, whites, and tone application.
But we are showing up, so we get paid assistant fees plus our commute and food expenses.
The working AC is nice too.
You are better off working on your own stuff too, Mashiro-kun.
Mashiro-kun, what is your prize-winning history?
Um, I have not won any.
I ran in NEXT! once, but...
Recently?
In May; it was called Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie.
That was you?!
The fifteen year old genius, Ashirogi Muto?!
So Ashirogi's a pen name?
Yes.
Another genius high schooler?
And a fifteen-year-old this time?!
I lost in NEXT!
You ranked third, I was fifth.
I am really glad an actual rival came.
Being able to draw Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie at fifteen is really something.
But it is not really a good fit for Jack.
It was too bleak.
There is a limit to how long you can keep something with that depiction appealing.
If it ran in the main magazine, I do not think it would rank high.
Though I probably just sound like a poor loser.
But you can bet I will be the poster boy for Jack in the near future.
Especially since in both Tezuka Awards I was in, Niizuka-kun got away with placing one prize above me.
But I will be getting back at him with my pen... in the main magazine!
So that means the lowest guy on the totem pole here is Nakai-san, huh?
He won the monthly prize just once about ten years ago, that is it.
If you are going to call Niizuma-kun sensei,
then why do not you call the two of us sensei too?
I am just kidding.
But Nakai-san, you are working as a pro-assistant right?
A pro-assistant?
A full-time assistant.
No, I am still...
So you are still thinking about serialization?
You are not getting any younger, you know.
And you are not doing anything in your free time, are you?
Even Yuujirou-san told me he is not hoping for anything out of you beyond being an assistant.
I will tell you this, I never want to end up like you, Nakai-san.
Do I have to work in a place with this kind of atmosphere?
Ah, I still have not explained how we work yet.
We pick up the manuscripts Sensei leaves on the ground and finish them with the fill-in inking and the tones.
Then we return them to precisely where they were.
Things to be filled in are marked with an X.
The tone numbers are written in blue.
Got it.
Then take a seat over there.
Just wait until Sensei puts the next manuscript down.
Um, is it all right if I observe near Niizuma-san?
No use doing that.
No use?
He is different from a sensei with a wealth of experience.
Niizuma-kun is not going to feel like teaching you a thing.
I do not think he is going to teach me something.
I am watching.
Among the people here, Niizuma-san's drawings are the best.
I really do not get kids these days.
And they sure are cheeky.
So are you.
You damn crow...
I will show you my true power!
Zukyuun, perspective point!
Did he just decide where the vanishing point for the background should be drawn?
Excuse me, you are slightly in the way.
Perfect!
He said to pick these up, finish them, and then put them back.
Huh?
Ashirogi-sensei!
Sensei?
Why are you here?
I am here as your assistant, Niizuma-san.
Eh?
Ashirogi-sensei should not be doing things like that.
I want you to be drawing manga!
Well no matter what I draw, the story is not done yet.
Even though you made Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie?
Takagi's the one who thinks up the stories.
I am Mashiro, I do the artwork.
Oh, is that how you do it?
Then Takagi-sensei has some incredible talent.
Yeah.
So while Takagi is making the story,
I thought I would try to learn something from you, Niizuma-san.
From me?
Is there anything you can learn?
Probably...
If you show me what you are drawing.
Then please sit down.
This way it will be easier for you, Ashirogi-sensei.
No, you are the one who is a sensei.
Even so, I am thrilled we could meet again at a place like this, Ashirogi-sensei.
Make yourself at home.
They sure seem to be getting along well.
I seriously do not get kids these days.
Which would you prefer, melon or chocolate?
Either one's fine.
Then here.
So what do you think of my cell phone novel?
Eh?!
You have already written all this!
Amazing!
Just what I would expect from an original manga author!
Yeah, but I cannot do my own name...
I wonder if Saikou ended up taking the assistant position...
Do not you think it would be weird for only Mashiro to be an assistant?
Even though you two are a team...
I do not draw, so I could not go with him.
Since the story's not done,
it makes me feel better knowing he is doing something rather than just waiting around.
Saikou's drawings could already pass as professional.
Ah, what you said really was true, Ashirogi-sensei.
Becoming number one is not that easy.
Eh?
Even with that first chapter?
Chapter one's rank was first, but chapter two's rank was fourth.
That was a shock.
Fourth is still amazing.
First chapters are usually on the covers and have color pages,
so it is not uncommon for them to take first.
Some people say that getting first with chapter one is a given,
and the real battle starts from chapter two.
Ah, Yuujirou-san said that too.
Bad works suddenly plummet down in the rankings at chapter two.
At fourth, you are within the popular mangas that already have animes.
You should not be shocked to be there at all.
He told me that too, but...
And Niizuma-san, you can draw manuscripts without even doing a name,
so I do not think your rank is going to fall any further.
Usually, once you turn in names for the first three chapters at a serialization meeting,
you have as much time as you want to work on them.
So chapters four and beyond usually get harder,
but you do not need to worry about that, Niizuma-san.
Oh, really?
After hearing that from you, Ashirogi-sensei, I am brimming with confidence!
I think you will be able to stay in the higher ranks,
and in a year you could get an anime adaptation and get first place again too!
Ooh, an anime and first place?
That is amazing!
No!
At the rate you are going, your rank will go down!
Fukuda-san.
You will be on the borderline by the tenth week, and in half a year you will be canceled!
Canceled?
I read copies of chapters three and four,
as well as the fifth there on the floor, and that is what I think!
Really?
Now I am worried!
Please let me see chapters three and four!
What do you think?
I think they are amazing as usual, but...
That quality made me want to read the one-shot and chapter one quickly, all at once.
But after reading chapters three and four, I have gotten used to it.
So I kind of feel like it is getting less interesting.
Yeah...
Amazing and interesting are different.
If the readers do not think it is interesting, the popularity will fall.
What should I do?
Maybe make it easier to understand so the readers can enjoy it more.
He is right.
As a pro, you are not self-conscious enough, Niizuma-kun.
If you just want to enjoy drawing for yourself, you would be better off drawing doujinshi.
But the people who draw in Jack are pros.
You need to put the enjoyment of the readers first.
Also, CROW does not have anything that appeals to the readers.
It is nothing more than cool, so people will get bored of it soon.
It is nothing more than cool?!
You went as far as calling him Ashirogi-sensei.
So you thought Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie was interesting, right?
Yes.
That is because it raises the question to readers of whether money and intelligence...
really are all that matter in this world, which makes it interesting.
You are right, I may not have anything like that.
The talent you have for drawing is certainly of a genius level.
But one might say that you are at a stage where only people who have read tons of manga,
like the guys at the editorial department, would be happy and say You are a genius!
You are incredible, Fukuda-san.
You are going beyond the editorial department.
Eh?
Most people aiming to become mangakas can do this kind of critique.
But they cannot draw an interesting one themselves.
Well, I can.
I have got it!
There are still two days until the deadline, so I am going to rewrite everything from chapter five onward!
Please help me make it more interesting!
Huh?
You have got to be kidding!
Why would we help out a rival?
Your advice was extremely incisive, Fukuda-san!
Like I said, why
Say, why was I giving advice in the first place?
But I want to try.
Mashiro-kun...
I want to try to figure out how to make CROW the best it can be!
Fine then, but just for chapter five.
We will work together and give completely unbiased opinions of it.
You all right with that?
Yes!
I thought you were kind of a jerk, Fukuda-san, but you are really a nice guy.
I am not a nice guy!
We are going to change Jack!
I just do not want my rival to fall apart here.
Oh, that sounds cool!
We are going to change Jack!
Anyway, let us make CROW get first place!
Yes!
Okay!
What is with these guys...
Is it youth?
No, they have ambition and talent...
So how can I make chapter five more interesting?
It has had the same feeling to it since chapter one, so maybe you should switch things up a bit?
Yeah.
Every chapter's all about what CROW does...
More than half of new series end without even making it through the first year.
By the end of the first ten chapters, you can tell if it is going to be a long series.
At this point, the major concern is keeping the reader interested.
Did not Yuujirou tell you that?
Well no, he did not.
He told me and I am not even serialized, but he did not tell you?
Just act like we are having meetings and you are writing names.
He said that though.
Yuujirou, always just doing whatever works!
Does not that mean he has faith in Niizuma-san's talent?
No.
When I said I did not want to do them,
he was kind of bothered at first, but we just ended up not doing them.
An editor that does not have meetings and an author that does not draw names?
Are you guys taking manga lightly?
But it is like drawing the same thing twice.
It takes all the tension out of it, it is a pain.
Not having meetings or showing him names?
Then the editor cannot judge if the thing's interesting or not!
And you are asking How can I make it more interesting?
You have got to be screwing with me!
I guess you are right...
So how do you think I could make it more interesting, Fukuda-sensei?
Hmph, now you call me sensei?
Ah, I first met you at the Tezuka Award award ceremony, Fukuda-sensei.
That was before your debut in NEXT!, so I have been saying Fukuda-san.
But you have debuted now, so it should be Fukuda-sensei.
Does any of that really matter right now?
Everyone is a sensei after they have had their debut.
Well in that case, the only one here who is not a sensei is Nakai-san.
It is too bad.
Eh?
I cannot believe he said that, and he is laughing!
Anyway!
You need to stop worrying about having fun yourself and start thinking about the reader's feelings.
Oh, the reader's feelings, huh?
Maybe something more heart-pounding and exciting...
He is right!
Make a proper climax in that chapter,
and end it with some cliffhanger that will make the readers want to keep reading.
Ooh!
Exciting, nervous, heart-pounding...
Climax!
Cliffhanger!
Unpredictability!
I did not say unpredictability, but...
That would be something good to have, though!
The answer is cliche.
Not like inking something black, but like something that reappears all the time!
TL Note: In Japanese, these two words are homonyms.
Both filling in something without gaps and cliche are called beta.
Like how cliche equals the opposite of unpredictability.
Excitement too!
If you end it with the enemies beaten, it is always the same!
I will change the enemy character, make him stronger, but then make it turn out he is really an ally.
Yeah, I think that sounds good.
It is definitely cliche, but it is the kind of plot development that will get the reader's blood pumping.
Standby!
And the music starts!
Do not just start off with the manuscript!
I do not like names...
We told you, that is no good!
We gave you advice, so we have a right to see if what you come up with is interesting or not!
Okay... I get it.
Gacha-pinch!
Monster!
I am done.
That was fast for nineteen whole pages.
You are telling me.
It is no use...
He did it too fast.
I could not analyze what his thought process was or how he organized it.
How is it?
Yeah, it is better.
True standby on the music!
With all that advice, he did this much in such a short time...
He may be a genius in a number of ways.
I will definitely surpass him though.
There is got to be something I can take from that kind of genius.
By the way, you could probably do the whole thing on your own, could not you, Mashiro-kun?
From what I saw, you know quite a lot about manga.
Believe me, I can tell.
And if two people are doing it, that halves your income.
I hear that can be tough.
No, we are doing it together.
My partner is far better at making stories than I am.
Well, I am heading home.
Niizuma-sensei, it looks like you will be redoing that whole thing, so I am taking off for the day.
I will be here at 3 PM tomorrow.
Ah, okay!
I will be half done by then!
Ashirogi-sensei and Nakai-san will not have anything to do until tomorrow afternoon either.
One more thing.
Leave the backgrounds to us.
In the time it would take you to do the scenery and the effects,
you would be way better off spending it thinking about what to do for the story.
Mm...
But I am more of an instinct-type.
I, too, believe that taking more time to think about the subject matter would make your works better.
Plus, you have got Nakai-san, do not you?
Nakai-san's been an assistant for over ten years.
If you are just talking about backgrounds, he can draw even better than Niizuma-kun.
And his technique's not bad either.
Is not that right, Nakai-san?
Yeah!
I can draw anything or any place from any angle without any reference.
And with effects, fill-in inked flashes or tone flashes,
I am faster than anyone!
That is not something to be proud of for someone who is trying to get serialized, though.
Whoa, I have got to go home and get to sleep.
I have got a part time job too.
Part time job?
Yeah, early mornings at a convenience store.
Being an assistant's not enough to make a living, you know.
But pretty soon, between the two jobs of part-time worker and mangaka, I will only be one of those.
See ya!
Good job today!
From how he looks, you would not think he is serious.
But he is really sticking to his guns.
Niizuma Eiji, Fukuda Shinta...
It looks like we will be battling it out together for the top of Jack.
But is it naIve to think that everyone will get serialized?
Mashiro-kun, want to go get something to eat?
Ah... okay.
I will have the steak set meal, the fried chicken from the side menu, a tuna capaccio and some french fries.
And after that, a banana parfait and a cream soda.
You can order whatever you want too, Mashiro-kun.
Ah... okay.
Niizuma-sensei's a very generous guy.
As long as we give him a receipt, we can eat whatever we want.
Right.
So what about you, Mashiro-kun?
Staying over tonight?
Yeah.
I would planned on working all night when I came here, though.
Is that so?
You sure are young.
You have got everything ahead of you.
We are back!
So he uses headphones at night.
Only because his editor told him to.
There is a nap room, want to rest for the night?
Nah, I think I will watch by Niizuma-san's side a little.
I want to be serialized...
II'm sorry.
No, somehow I understand how you feel.
It must be painful to hear.
SSorry.
It would probably be a little easier for me to get serious as a pro-assistant and take pride in that.
But I do not want to throw away my dream of being a mangaka, no matter what.
And yet I just drag myself around everywhere just being an assistant...
Now I am already thirty-three...
No matter what, do not be an assistant for a long time.
Okay.
Good morning.
Good morning.
Crow, huh?
Crow!
Crow!
Crow!
He is already done all this?
Black wings!
He did not put in any backgrounds!
This might be worth doing.
Let us get busy!
Wings, wings, wings, wings!
Okay.
Last three!
Incredible...
Nakai-san can do undersketches for such complex backgrounds freehand,
and then ink it perfectly!
Crow!
Thanks for all the work.
Thanks for coming.
Thanks for coming.
Thanks.
Niizuma-kun, chapter five is... which one?
There are so many I cannot tell.
Ah sorry, it is not done yet.
It is not?
Two days ago over the phone, you said it was already done...
I am redrawing it.
Eh?
Here is the name for chapter five.
Name?
You wrote a name?
What is this?!
This is incredibly interesting!
So it really is interesting?
Yeah, it is great.
Yuujirou-san, I am sorry for being so cocky up until now.
From now on, I will do the meetings and draw the names.
What brought this on?
I think that from everyone telling me I was a genius so much, I turned into a goblin.
I see...
Well, that way I can be a lot more relaxed about this.
And now becoming the number one author in Jack really is not just a dream!
It is not just a dream?
For the early report of chapter three, you are third!
Even better than chapter two.
Chapter three was better?
It was different from how we read it.
I do not regret it though.
We made chapter five more interesting and got him to do meetings and names.
Yay!
I am going to be the most popular mangaka!
I was glad that Eiji was drawing names now too.
But I came here for Shuujin's sake.
I have got to bring something back...
It must be a pain drawing a manga with two people.
But together, we can get through things really quickly!
If it were me, I would always be getting in fights.
I trust my partner!
Next time, Jealousy and Love.
I guess we are going after the same dream.
